15-year-old.context: The patient is a 15-year-old child with history of a right tympanic membrane perforation following tube placement as well as right conductive hearing loss.

right tympanic membrane perforation.context: The patient is a 15-year-old child with history of a right tympanic membrane perforation following tube placement as well as right conductive hearing loss.

right conductive hearing loss.context: The patient is a 15-year-old child with history of a right tympanic membrane perforation following tube placement as well as right conductive hearing loss.

posterior superior right marginal tympan.context: Exam in the office revealed a posterior superior right marginal tympanic perforation.

bleeding.context: Risks and benefits of surgery including risk of bleeding, general anesthesia, hearing loss as well as recurrent perforation were discussed with the mother.

general anesthesia.context: Risks and benefits of surgery including risk of bleeding, general anesthesia, hearing loss as well as recurrent perforation were discussed with the mother.

hearing loss.context: Risks and benefits of surgery including risk of bleeding, general anesthesia, hearing loss as well as recurrent perforation were discussed with the mother.

recurrent perforation.context: Risks and benefits of surgery including risk of bleeding, general anesthesia, hearing loss as well as recurrent perforation were discussed with the mother.

right ear examination under anesthesia.context: Procedure: Right ear examination under anesthesia.

granuloma.context: The patient was noted to have large granuloma under the tympanic membrane at the anterior border of the drum.

debrided.context: The granulation tissue was debrided as much as possible.

Floxin drops.context: The middle ear space was filled with Floxin drops.
